# Regression models: interactions {#sec-regression-interaction} ![](https://img.shields.io/badge/Area-Statistics-red) ![](https://img.shields.io/badge/Area-R-green) ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} polite <- read_csv("data/winter2012/polite.csv") ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} f0_bm_int <- brm( f0mn ~ gender + attitude + gender:attitude, family = gaussian, data = polite, cores = 4, seed = 7123, file = "cache/ch-regression-interaction_f0_bm_int" ) ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} summary(f0_bm_int) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Family: gaussian Links: mu = identity; sigma = identity Formula: f0mn ~ gender + attitude + gender:attitude Data: polite (Number of observations: 212) Draws: 4 chains, each with iter = 2000; warmup = 1000; thin = 1; total post-warmup draws = 4000 Regression Coefficients: Estimate Est.Error l-95% CI u-95% CI Rhat Bulk_ESS Tail_ESS Intercept 256.56 5.20 246.38 267.27 1.00 2632 2950 genderM -119.38 7.66 -134.08 -104.50 1.00 2532 2665 attitudepol -17.48 7.28 -31.76 -3.18 1.00 2573 2806 genderM:attitudepol 6.65 10.67 -14.20 27.47 1.00 2191 2693 Further Distributional Parameters: Estimate Est.Error l-95% CI u-95% CI Rhat Bulk_ESS Tail_ESS sigma 39.10 1.94 35.52 43.14 1.00 3834 2779 Draws were sampled using sampling(NUTS). For each parameter, Bulk_ESS and Tail_ESS are effective sample size measures, and Rhat is the potential scale reduction factor on split chains (at convergence, Rhat = 1). ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} conditional_effects(f0_bm_int, "gender:attitude") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](ch-regression-interaction_files/figure-html/f0-bm-int-cond-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} f0_bm_int_draws <- as_draws_df(f0_bm_int) ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} f0_bm_int_draws <- f0_bm_int_draws |> mutate( f_inf = b_Intercept, f_pol = b_Intercept + b_attitudepol, m_inf = b_Intercept + b_genderM, m_pol = b_Intercept + b_genderM + b_attitudepol + `b_genderM:attitudepol` ) ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(posterior) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` This is posterior version 1.6.1 ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Attaching package: 'posterior' ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': mad, sd, var ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` The following objects are masked from 'package:base': %in%, match ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} f0_bm_int_draws |> mutate( m_pol_inf = m_pol - m_inf ) |> summarise( mean_diff = mean(m_pol_inf), sd_diff = sd(m_pol_inf), lo_diff = quantile2(m_pol_inf, probs = 0.025), hi_diff = quantile2(m_pol_inf, probs = 0.975) ) |> round() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
````` ::: :::
